titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Skagit County Oral History Project records 1962-1979
Skagit County Oral History Project records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by CPNWS staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Western Washington University, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Rozlind Koester 2012
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.unittitle: Skagit County Oral History Project records
did.abstract: This is a collection of microfilmed copies of oral history interview transcripts. The interviews were conducted by the Skagit County Historical Society between 1962 and 1979. Topics covered include social life, historical change, politics, agriculture, fishing, and timber.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of microfilmed copies of oral history interview transcripts. The interviews were conducted by the Skagit County Historical Society between 1962 and 1979. Topics covered include social life, historical change, politics, agriculture, fishing, and timber.

altformavail.p: This collection is entirely in microfilm format. Original recordings and transcripts were maintained by the Skagit County Historical Society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public (appointments highly recommended for access to microform reader).

separatedmaterial.p: The Skagit County Historical Society and Museum in LaConner, Washington, houses the original interview audio recordings and transcripts.

prefercite.p: Skagit County Oral History Project records, Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, Western Washington University, Bellingham WA 98225-9123.

processinfo.head: About Harmful Language and Content
processinfo.p: To learn more about problematic content in our collections, collection description and teaching tools (including how to provide feedback or request dialogue on this topic), see the following Statement About Potentially Harmful Language and Content

acqinfo.p: Donated by the Skagit County Historical Society

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
